The Questions of the Youth Posāla
“One who speaks of the past,

analyzed: id posālo  an ejaḥ chinna sa sayaḥ
translated: (so said the venerable Posāla)🔽Unwavering, doubts cut off;

analyzed: pāragum sabba dhammāna  atthi pañhena āgama
translated: Gone beyond all things,🔽I ask about the one who has gone beyond.
For one who has transcended perception of form,
who has given up the whole world,
both internally and externally,
who sees that there is nothing at all;
I ask about the knowledge of such a one,
how such a one should be guided”.
“All the stations of consciousness,
(Posāla, said the Blessed One)
the Tathāgata has directly known;
while standing he knows this,
liberated, not subject to future rebirth.
Having known the origin of the base of nothingness,
and that delight is a fetter;
having directly known this,
he then sees it here.
This is the knowledge of such a one,
the brahmin who has lived the spiritual life”.
The Questions of the Youth Posāla is the fourteenth.
